1.speaker: Digi
1.transcript: In this game, we decided to make it suck. No one had to play this game, so it didn't have to be good. That was our philosophy going into it.

newplan.speaker: Digi
newplan.transcript: This is the only route in the game that I was the writing director for. Pakoo basically handled all the other ones, except for a few exceptions.

newplan.speaker: Digi
newplan.transcript: I hope that that doesn't mean that this route has a vastly different writing style than the rest of the game, though. Worked really hard to try to match it.

hitme.speaker: Digi
hitme.transcript: This MIDI of {i}Hit Me With Your Best Shot{/i} is hilariously bad, but we didn't want to get CS copyright-struck.

everlong.speaker: Digi
everlong.transcript: For the backing track here, I'm pretty sure I asked Pakoo to get "something like {i}Everlong{/i} by the Foo Fighters", and he just got a MIDI of Everlong. It's pretty funny, though!

madlibs.speaker: Digi
madlibs.transcript: This is where we reveal the gimmick of this route! Basically, every route had a gimmick. The True route is a road trip, the fanboy route is an RPG, and this route is a Mad Libs.

madlibs.speaker: Digi
madlibs.transcript: This was inspired by me literally digging through the Ren'Py documentation and figuring out there was a function to store text input into variables. It was all downhill from there!

hidemovie.speaker: Arceus
hidemovie.transcript: So, funny story about this choice: I remember, back in 2017, with the release of {i}CSBII,{/i} I'd never programmed anything in my life. At the time, I was only doing video editing in high school. So, I made this silly "kick" edit. When the team asked me how to add it in, I had zero idea what I was doing.

hidemovie.speaker: Arceus
hidemovie.transcript: But, I vaguely remember sitting in a hotel room tinkering with various solutions, and I remember shouting "Holy {i}shit,{/i} I figured it out!", by delaying the end of the movie with "hide movie with dissolve", which lead to about 30 minutes to me playing with the number of "hide movie with dissolve"s. The total number ended up being 141 lines.

hidemovie.speaker: Arceus
hidemovie.transcript: Thankfully, we found the proper way to do it.

fightminigame.speaker: Arceus
fightminigame.transcript: So, the fight minigame, I had programmed whilst I was in Alabama visiting Digi (shout-out to PJ and Cody for the place to sleep), I remember, we grinded out the minigame basically in a single night.

fightminigame.speaker: Arceus
fightminigame.transcript: Another thing to note, though, however: we went to Aldi the afternoon of programming, and I had bought a bottle of wine. By the end of the evening, that wine was gone.

prisonroute.speaker: Arceus
prisonroute.transcript: I was the man responsible for writing the prison escape scene. I believe, to this date, it was the only thing I actually wrote. I never actually {i}expected{/i} to be a wingman or a secondary main character. Honestly, it felt pretty selfish of me.

prisonroute.speaker: Arceus
prisonroute.transcript: But, then, I was basically just told straight-up, "Yeah, we had no one else, and you were just... {i}there".{/i}

tint.speaker: Arceus
tint.transcript: These lighting effects actually are generated when the game first starts up. I figured out how to apply a TintMatrix to an image and alter its color and lighting.

tint.speaker: Kitty
tint.transcript: But, then, together, we altered it to be what you see now.

hohsisfight.speaker: Pakoo
hohsisfight.transcript: So, at this scene in the game, in the original version of {i}CSBI,{/i} we were going to have this huge fight scene where he's going through the HoH SiS HQ, beating up workers, but we didn't have the time, and we didn't know how to, y'know, do this whole scene. So, when we started working on {i}this{/i} game, I wanted to include that.

hohsisfight.speaker: Pakoo
hohsisfight.transcript: And, y'know, I even went out by making sound effects and transitions. It was the first thing I did in this game, and it was super-fun to do.

5years.speaker: Pakoo
5years.transcript: This part of the {i}CSBIII{/i} script, we worked back on in 2018, and, we didn't actually {i}do{/i} anything with it for about five years... until we started working on the game in 2023.

donuts.speaker: Tate
donuts.transcript: Oh, God... {i}this{/i} line. If you were there for CS' initial playthrough stream of {i}CSBIII,{/i} then, you may remember this. The original line read as follows: "CS, Anno, and Arceus cheers their donuts together." I'm sorry, {i}what?{/i}

donuts.speaker: Tate
donuts.transcript: I absolutely {i}hated{/i} it! Not only was I having trouble thinking of a replacement, but, I faced some pushback from Digi, who {i}loved{/i} the line! I'm pretty sure he's the one who wrote it, but don't quote me on that. Eventually, everyone kinda forgot about fixing it {i}at all{/i} until that stream happened...

tate_ex.speaker: Tate
tate_ex.transcript: So, it was never in the original plan to have {i}any{/i} kind of RPG battles in Train route, especially not one against... {i}me.{/i} I mean, yeah, I'm the one who wrote most of the route, but, somehow, making myself into a boss fight seemed... narcissistic? My hope is that the name of the achievement {i}at least{/i} makes it clear that I am self-aware.

tate_ex.speaker: Tate
tate_ex.transcript: Sometimes, plans change when you get inspired by some random royalty-free breakcore EP and end up hyperfocusing on art and code for a straight week, nonstop. I hope the fight is as fun to play as it was to create.

tate_ex.speaker: Tate
tate_ex.transcript: Also, fun fact about this fight: Tate EX's double-edged attacks are an all-new mechanic, exclusive to {i}DX.{/i} This battle actually ended up breaking the entire RPG system... {i}twice.{/i}
